intro: Diplocaulobium flavicolle, commonly known as the yellow-stemmed spiderwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems that often display a distinctive yellowish hue. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
